N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5901.4 - Proposal requirements

State Regulations
(a) A
regional high technology development organization shall submit to the office a
written proposal in response to a request for proposals requesting funds from
the technology development organization program. (b) The proposal shall include the following
information: (1)
a description of the
regional high technology development organization, including: (i) the history of the
organization; (ii)
the structure of
the organization, e.g., corporation membership, association, agency; (iii)
the mission or purpose; (iv)
the governing body, committee structure
and current memberships; (v) the
capability and capacity to achieve its stated purpose; and
(vi)
the sources and amounts of revenue, committed and projected, to undertake the mission; (2)
a description of the specific economic
development activities and anticipated economic outcomes for which support from
the office is requested; (3)
certifications regarding the availability and source of matching funds to be
committed to the activities described in the proposal; (4)
a short- and longer-range plan of
strategies and actions, including provisions for the development of an
accessible information/data base on the region, and a high technology marketing
strategy; (5)
a description of the
region's current high technology private sector base, including a description
of the involvement of large and small firms; (6)
a description of the region's educational
resources which relate to and are active in the high technology development
effort; and
(7)
a description of
the region's ability to support the high technology development, including: (i) available natural resources; (ii)
physical infrastructure resources; and
(iii)
labor force
availability; (8)
a
description of the region's needs with respect to effectively supporting high
technology economic development activities and the applicant's proposed
strategy to address such needs; and
(9)
such other information as required in the
request for proposals issued by the office. Notes
